name: Farhana Rahman
bio: Chef Farhana Rahman is a renowned Bangladeshi chef who has been working in the culinary industry for over 25 years. He is known for his fusion cuisine, which combines traditional Bangladeshi flavors with international techniques. cooking_method: Clean and marinate the fish. Heat oil in a pan and fry the fish. In the same oil, fry the onions and tomatoes. Add the spices and cook until the oil separates. Add water and let it boil. Add the fried fish and cook for a few more minutes. Serve hot with rice.

name: Nadia Ahmed
bio: Chef Nadia Ahmed is a rising star in the Bangladeshi culinary scene, known for her focus on traditional Bengali cuisine. She has worked at several high-end restaurants in Dhaka, and has recently opened her own restaurant, which has been praised for its authentic dishes and use of local ingredients.
cooking_method: Clean and cut the chicken into pieces. Heat oil in a pan and fry the chicken. In the same oil, fry the onions, ginger, and garlic. Add the spices and cook until the oil separates. Add water and let it boil. Cover and simmer until the chicken is cooked. Serve hot with rice.

name: Abdul Khan
bio: Chef Abdul Khan is a popular Bangladeshi chef and television personality, known for her cooking show, he has published several cookbooks, and is known for her simple, yet flavorful dishes that can be easily prepared at home.
cooking_method: Clean and marinate the mutton. Heat oil in a pan and fry the mutton. In the same oil, fry the onions, ginger, and garlic. Add yogurt and cook until the oil separates. Add water and let it boil. Cover and simmer until the mutton is cooked. Add kewra water and saffron. Serve hot with rice.

name: Rima Chowdhury
bio: Chef Rima Chowdhury is a Bangladeshi chef and restaurateur who has opened several successful restaurants in the United States, serving traditional Bengali cuisine. She is known for his use of fresh, locally sourced ingredients and his commitment to promoting Bangladeshi cuisine to a wider audience.
cooking_method: Clean and devein the shrimp. Heat oil in a pan and fry the shrimp. In the same oil, fry the onions, ginger, and garlic. Add coconut milk and cook until the oil separates. Add water and let it boil. Add the fried shrimp and cook for a few more minutes. Serve hot with rice.

name: Karim Uddin
bio: Chef Karim Uddin is a respected Bangladeshi chef who has worked in some of the country's top hotels and restaurants. He is known for his expertise in Bangladeshi seafood dishes, and is considered a master of the 'Pani Puri' cooking technique, in which fish is cooked in banana leaves.

name: Rahim Ahmed
bio: ChefRahim Ahmed is a Bangladeshi chef and cookbook author, known for her focus on healthy, plant-based cooking. She has published several cookbooks and hosts a cooking show that emphasizes the health benefits of Bangladeshi cuisine. Chef Rahim Ahmed is also an advocate for sustainable agriculture and works closely with local farmers to promote organic farming practices.
